comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Thank you for your reply.

As far as I can see, this script is used on many websites - https://publicwww.com/websites/%22%2Fwp-content%2Fplugins%2Fgoogle-analytics-for-wordpress%2F%22/ but it seems that in most (or probably all) cases the path of this script looks like this - `/wp-content/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/js/frontend-gtag.min.js`, so perhaps the current rule can be replaced.

Could you please add these rules:
```adblock
/wp-content/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/js/frontend-gtag.min.js
/wp-content/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/*$badfilter
```
to user rules and then check if issue still occurs?

comment.body:
Regarding first issue (ad leftovers), this element has `display: block !important` on my end, so it's not hidden by apps.
This rule:
```adblock
cnet.com##body .ad-slot
```
works fine for me.

comment.body:
Please enable AdGuard protection for Dcinside app.
Or, please reset your AdGuard configuration.
By doing so, you should see only PowerLink advertisement in the app, unless you use a web browser instead of the app.

<details><summary>Korean - 한국어</summary>

디시인사이드 앱에 대한 AdGuard 보호를 활성화해주세요.
또는, AdGuard 설정을 초기화해보세요.
그렇게 함으로써, 앱 대신에 웹 브라우저를 사용하시지 않는 이상 파워링크 광고만 보시게 됩니다.

</details>
